_header: All ye mowen of joy sing / Fro heaven us come
Note:
Ringler Jr. (1992)
XRingler Jr., William A. Bibliography and Index of English Verse in Manuscript 1501-1558. London: Mansell, 1992; prepared and completed by Michael Rudick and Susan J. Ringler TM 1344.
_description: A carol in praise of the Virgin Mary — six quatrains (aaab) with Latin caudae and burden: ‘Virgo rosa virginum / tuum precare Filium’

OxfBal354.First Lines:
Qvene of hevyn blessyd mot þou beFor Godis son born he was of
                    the…
OxfBal354.Last Lines:
…That we may to his blis cumGloria tibi
                    domineExplicit
OxfBal354.Note:
This MS only 3 stanzas, 3 x 4 (aaab) including refrain, ‘Gloria
                        tibi domine’, and burden (cc): ‘Virgo rosa virginum /
                        Tuum precor.’
OxfBal354.Facsimiles:
Early Manuscripts at Oxford University: Facsimile
                    of Oxford, Balliol MS 354.
         (http://image.ox.ac.uk/show?collection=balliol&manuscript=ms354).

Rickert,  Edith,
                        ed.  
             Ancient English Christmas Carols.
         London: Chatto & Windus, 1910: 22-3.

CamGon383.First Lines:
Alle ȝe mouwen of ioye syngefro heuene ys come god
                    tyþyng…
CamGon383.Last Lines:
…þat we mowen wyt hym woneIn perheum
                    Gloria
CamGon383.Note:
This MS 6 x 4, aaab, where ‘b’ is Latin, plus burden, b:
                        ‘Virgo rosa virginum tuum precare filium.’
